intro: Adnaria glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular adnaria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels. Adnaria glandulosa is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its glandular surfaces and distinctive appearance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
